But they were tucked in against the wall where we couldn't see them, meaning the linen had not been changed on that bed, since the previous occupant. Yuck. The next day, it still was not changed. The next day, we pulled the linen back so the stains were visible, and only then was it changed. Otherwise, there were no issues with cleanliness - but this is pretty gross. Other: The bathroom... ? There is NO privacy. The "door" is a translucent sliding glass, and there's a large translucent window in the shower, allowing the person in the room to see the silhouette of the person showering. Also, the shower has no curtain or door, so water spills on the floor while you're showering.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: rchrisrj
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. The location is perfect the hotel is centered in shopping area. It´s quite close to Notre Dame and even closer to two Metro stations, very easy for getting around.The staff was friendlyl. Very clean and modern rooms, not big - with a holiday inn you know what you are getting. The bathroom was small but the breakfast selection was very good. The internet service was expensive. The roof top bar - only open Thursday, Friday and Saturdays from 16.30 was spacious and excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - would definitely recommend. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: kellster22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just come back from a two-night stay at the Holiday Inn Notre Dame and would thoroughly recommend it. As echoed by other reviews, the hotel is in an excellent location - close enough to walk to some attractions and right by a main Metro hub for others. There are lots of great restaurants and cafes nearby. Our room was adequately sized and good value for the tariff. The decor was modern, everything was perfectly clean and (most importantly for us) the room was quiet at night. There was also good air-conditioning, a flat screen TV (although BBC World News was the only English-speaking channel) and tea and coffee making facilities. Whilst we didn't eat in the hotel, the staff we met on reception and in the lobby bar were extremely helpful and friendly, all speaking excellent English. Finally, our transfer to and from CDG airport was really easy - at just over 9 Euros per person on RER line B (straight to St Michel Notre Dame) and a 5 min walk to the hotel. I would definitely stay at the Holiday Inn again on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless holiday, great rooftop bar”
Reviews.Author: Bobbio
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a hot summer weekend, the cool inside was very welcome, service was prompt, efficient and friendly. The room had twin beds and a double sofa, there was adequate storage and a powerful shower over the bath. There was an odd arrangement for lighting the bathroom with natural light - a clear window between the bed and the bath, there was a transliucent roller blind bit it was not very effective at preserving privacy. The roof top bar - only open Thursday Friday and Saturdays from 16.30 was spacious and excellent - and expensive. The location is quite close to Notre Dame and even closer to two Metro stations, very easy for getting around. Breakfast is much cheaper (and smaller) in the ground floor bar than in the basement breakfast room. Liked most of it, disliked the bath window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter65
Reviews.Content: This hotel scores on location. You are in the heart of the city. Its a boutique hotel. Compact, but nice. The rooms are a bit small, but clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and polite. The views of Paris from the terrace bar are spectacular specially in the evenings. One of the most romantic places to be. There are more reasons to return to this hotel again than not.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TooOldtosurf
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Notre Dame is in a great location. We loved being near Notre Dame and right in the middle of the restaurants and great shopping. Also, being near the Metro and RER was a good option for moving around the city. There is a Vinci parking garage within half a block of the hotel, clean and extremely convenient. The hotel staff has great english and are very helpful. The hotel was modern and clean. One of our rooms was pretty quirky, it had a window between the bedroom and the shower. You could sit and watch someone shower or watch TV, your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Lovely Hotel, Rooftop deck view can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: Buckeyetraveler01
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel on her 70th birthday trip. The location was perfect. One block from both the subway and the rail station. The hotel was lovely and the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and very quiet. There is a rooftop deck with an incredible view. You can watch the light up of the Eiffel Tower every evening. Better than 4th of July fireworks. Restaurants, shops, and a little market all just steps from the hotel entrance, and can't forget the little bakery right around the corner where we stopped every evening.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with a first-class staff”
Reviews.Author: JasonJ1943
Reviews.Content: For our first visit to Paris we were looking for a centrally located hotel in proximity to key sights and museums. We also needed a wheelchair-accessible room. This hotel is a gem. The staff is responsive to your needs, especially when something out-of-the-ordinary happens (as occurred with my wheelchair the 2nd day of our stay). The handicapped room was small, short on closet space, but very attractive. The manager went out of his way to correct a shower seating issue. The buffet breakfast is outstanding: great variety and top quality. We'll stay here the next time we're in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lausperene
Reviews.Content: We got to this Hotel after not being able to book our first Hotel option given by a friend of ours that goes to Paris often. We don't know how that first option was going to be, but we are very, very pleased that we found this Hotel. Location is great, walking distance to Notre Dame, Le Louvre, great restaurants...also the terrace is great, we were there is March and it was freezing, but still great to be on top of a 9 floor building with a view to the Eiffel Tower. Rooms are small but clean and with a modern look, breakfast was fair, and staff, specially front office staff, was very friendly and helpfull. Next time in Paris this will be my first option, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: chudi
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd trip to paris, I love the city, and the hotel I booked earlier cancelled out on me..I had earlier stayed at the holiday inn montmatre on my second visit..so i decided to try the holiday inn notre dame. The staff were polite, friendly and nice. The room well appointed, I got the one with a view of the eiffel tower, it also had a balcony. The location was very central, with the metro nearby and tour buses too...its a walking distance to the notre dame cathedral, the river seine, saint chapelle, the louvre and chatelet with all the cafes and resturants. I will recommend this hotel to anyone visiting paris..who is not on a tight budget, because the rooms are in the EUR180 - EUR300 range.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: mslawik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the perfect location. Close to a lot of attractions. It's close to a lot of great restaurants and very close to the metro. The rooms are a bit small by north american standards, but still very comfortable. The view from the roof is spectacular, but they don't allow you to go up in the evening. The front desk staff was a bit snooty, but I think that's a french thing. Still a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gmjj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three days in May primarily because of good reviews, and its ideal location for public transportation since we were backpacking across Europe. The room was small but clean and adequate, the staff was very helpful. The roof top terrace was absolutely amazing, especially at sunset, with Eiffel tower as the backdrop. Only problem was finding the hotel initially. Best way to get to the hotel from St. Michel metro is to locate the fountain at St. Michel first, with the river Seine behind you, and the fountain in front of you, then rue Danton is only a 2 minute walk on your right hand side as you walk further away from the river. There are lots of little eateries around, the Louvre is within walking distance, and metro is practically at your door step. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little expensive but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Juan_Alejandro
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location. I did not use metro or subway often to visit everything interested in Paris. Clean and friendly staff, poor English but understandable. Breakfast is expensive but you van get a really French breakfast few block away.

Reviews.Title: “Room was very Small....but good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kinseye77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for sightseeing in Paris, really close to Notre Dame & eiffel Tower can be seen from roof top terrace which was great. The latin quarter is right on the door step and there are some great shops and resturants. i Would recommend a crepe from one of the street stalls - delicious!! The room wa really small, with not much space at all, especially in the bath room. The toliet was in a very tight space. The shower weas HUGE & took up most of the bathroom. The roof top terrace and the bar were really nice & the staff were very friendly. Would visit the hotel again, but would request a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel: Best bed in the world...”
Reviews.Author: kimberleys86
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough that my dad loaned me some of his Holiday Inn points when it came to staying in this hotel, so I wasn't paying for the experience, but even if I had been, I still would have been impressed! The staff were very friendly, eager to speak English (not necessary for me as I speak fluent french, but very useful all the same!) which they had a high level of, and very accomodating! We'd been upgraded to an executive room, which boasted a beautiful bathroom, king size bed, so-so view (but thats OK, we had the whole of Paris to explore!), sofa, desk, ipod dock and even a British power socket! Only bizarre feature was the window between the bathroom and the bedroom, which meant showering became less of a private experience - even with the blind down, if the lights were on, everything was visible! (We managed by pulling the blinds down, turning the lights off in the bathroom, but keeping them on in the hallway!). We picked this hotel for its location and were very satisfied, was smack bang in the middle of the latin quarter, easy walking distance to everything and very close to a metro station! Didn't try the breakfasts, 17euro for a continental sounded very pricey to our ears when a mere two minutes away you could get a nutella & banana crepe for four euros from a stall on the corner (also recommended!). And the bed.... possibly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on in my life... amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: highfly
Reviews.Content: We saw this place when it was being turned into a hotel on a previous trip to Paris and thought the location was great so kept an eye out for it. We booked 3 nights on Priority Club points and got upgraded to a slightly better room with a very small sofa. Very easy to get to from the airport - no need to change stations, and about 4 mins walk. Lovely area with every type of bar and restaurant you could want just steps away and a little supermarket a couple of doors away to stock up. Pleasant lobby/bar area. Room was small but had all we needed. Very quiet as it looked out onto a side street behind hotel. Bathroom was one of those capsules which are all preformed but great shower etc. Bit funny that there is a clear window from bathroom to bedroom with a sort of see through blind. Roof terrace on top floor is lovely with nice views and we looked down from it to the rooms I assume are the executive ones with little balconies which looked nice. All in all a great base in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, good hotel, small room”
Reviews.Author: reportingfromupclose
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - walking distance from Notre Dame, Latin Quarter and metro stops. You can even walk to Louvre if weather is good and you are in the mood (20 mins or so). Lots of restaurants nearby, easy g snack / water shopping possible if needed. Rooms are somewhat small - but then how much time will you spend in them

Reviews.Title: “Great Location just not impressive”
Reviews.Author: ngozi23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a GREAT location. If you stay here, you will be in the heart of the Latin Quarter, and every restaurant is in the neighborhood. The Metro (St. Michel) is across the street and the RER (St. Michel-Notre Dame) is one block away. Let me acknowledge the hotel staff, we had to change hotels and arrived well before check in time. Staff kept our luggage safe and secured a room for us before the scheduled check-in time. The rooms are small and dark, there was a weird smell in the room and never quite figured out what was going on but I ONLY smelled it walking in the room. Once you were in the room, you didn't notice it anymore. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was compact and VERY CLEAN! The staff forgot to exchange the dirty glasses and refill the tea the first night but fixed the issue the second and third night. Breakfast did not come with the hotel rate which was very expensive. . . location, location, location. Staff TRIED their best to help and give directions, but none could speak very good English. When we checked out someone had charged breakfast to our room which was interesting considering we were in Brussells at the time. Hotel staff quickly corrected the issue! The rooms had a dark decor, the hallways were dark...I just wasn't impressed. However, I will definitely acknowledge that the hotel was in a great location, it was very clean, and the beds were comfortable. There was a nice courtyard in the back of the hotel. No free internet! Again, it goes to location, location, location. Very convenient to metro line, ATM, restaurants, bus and 24 hour cafe. Would I stay here again? No. This was my second time to Paris and I loved the location of this hotel, but was not impressed with the dark decor of the room, the smell, and the expensive breakfast. I'd find a different hotel in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “great lousy location but no service”
Reviews.Author: NigelandLiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on our last few nights in Paris. The location is perfect – near Notre Dame and close enough to walk everywhere. We opted for an 8th floor room that had Eiffel tower and Parisian rooftop views. It was lovely to see the twinkling lights of Paris as we fell asleep each night. The service however was appalling. Our room was not ready on the afternoon of our arrival and we had to wait an hour and a half. The reception apologized but their tone said “I could not care less”. On our last evening when we returned to our room at 5:00pm after being out all day the room had not even been made up. We had to ask on more than one occasion to have this attended to and when it was it was a shabby job. So to sum up, location good, view lovely, service, what service and this was in low season! Service did not exist!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Notre Dame is very well positioned for exploring Paris. An easy walk from the Notre Dame Cathedral, it's very close to the Louvre and also bus stops for the Paris Hop-on Hop-off bus (which takes you to the Eiffel Tower and other attractions further away). The hotel is modern and clean and despite having a decor of pink and purple, it all somehow comes together look pleasant and trendy. On check in (at 2pm) the staff asked us to wait in the lounge while they checked that the room was cleaned - 40 minutes later I discovered that the staff member I had been dealing with had gone on a break and forgotten to tell us that the room was ready. The front desk staff all came across a bit cold and not overly friendly. On the other hand, the breakfast room and bar staff were all very professional and friendly. Greetings as you walked past the bar and attentive service in the breakfast room was appreciated. Breakfast was included on our room rate and consisted of a buffet including fresh croissants, baguettes, toast (with a variety of spreads), cereals, hot food (eggs, bacon etc), cheeses, cold meats and Nespresso Coffee, to name a few of the options. Our room was on the 8th level with a small balcony overlooking the city. The room was quite small, yet comfortable with closet space, a safe, mini bar and TV (with 2 English speaking channels - BBC and CNN). The bathroom was a little bit strange, with a frosted glass door leading into the bedroom which couldn't close fully and a window in the shower area that was only partially frosted (the bottom 1/2 was while the top 1/2 wasn't) - although the 8th floor was higher than any nearby buildings so there was little chance anyone could see you - and if they could, you'd have to be well over 6-foot tall and even then it would have been shoulders only. The shower was nice, with dual functions of an overhead shower, a separate movable shower-head and also sprayers that came on from the sides of the shower (in the walls) - something I've never seen before! I'd recommend this hotel for the location. If you can, get a price that includes breakfast as it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Milangel
Reviews.Content: It's very hard to find a good hotel in Paris for a decent price, but this one definitely fits the bill. The location in the Latin Quarter is spectacular. The metro is convenient, restaurants are abundant, the area is lively, and it's incredibly close to the Seine River, Notre Dame, St Michel fountain. the Cluny Museum, a Monoprix, and Starbucks. There are also several Metro stations in the area and ATM access is convenient. The rooms are on the small side, which is probably the hardest thing for most Americans to get use to. We do love our space and unless you want to pay an exorbitant price for a room you just aren't going to get that in the more popular areas of Paris. I'm not sure of the camera lens they are using in the pictures on the website but they definitely make it look like you are getting more space than you get. I specifically chose a King Executive thinking that I was getting a larger room, I was sorely disappointed. The room was very narrow and cramped. I certainly wouldn't want to be stuck here on a stormy day. I discovered where the large rooms in the hotel really were when I went to the rooftop deck and checked out the floor plan on the top floor. Those were the types of rooms I thought I was booking when I chose an executive. When I inquired about the rooms I was told that they were suites and they could be booked on the website. I've tried several times using different dates and no they can not. If someone else figures out the secret to doing this let me know. If I stay in this hotel again that's the type of room I want. The rooms are very dark. A lot darker than they appear on the website. It's not that sun doesn't get into the rooms, it's just the colors they chose and the lighting is just atrocious. Mostly florescent lighting is used and it's quite annoying. Chocolate, tea, and coffee are complimentary in the room as well as an electric kettle. It was very much appreciated. There is also a minibar that can double as a very small fridge. It came in handy. The one amenity that should be provided in every room that isn't is an iron and ironing board. I really don't understand why this isn't automatically provided. You have to request one and iron all of your clothes that day because the front desk will call you and ask for it's return. The irons they do use are lightweight and cheap. The first one they sent up to me was a fire hazard. The biggest disappointment in my room was the bathroom. It was pretty enough, but not very functional. The toilet seat was too close to the opposite wall so if you have long legs beware. If you sit on the toilet your knees will probably be rubbing against the wall. The handle on the sink faucet was probably my biggest pet peeve. It's one of those kind that is almost flush with the rest of the fixture and you have to twist it to turn the water on. It's practically impossible to get a grip of the thing if you have wet, soapy hands. I didn't mind the window next to the bathtub because I was the only one in the room. Although I could never open the curtains while I was in the bathroom for fear of the apartment dwellers across the street being able to see in. I assume that the window was placed in the bathroom to conserve energy and allow natural light in. Another problem I noted was getting in and out of the bathtub/ shower. The bathtub ledge is rather high and there is no railing to grab on to. This was easy enough for me to deal with but I can't imagine it being easy for an older person or children. Getting out of a slippery tub with no railing to grab onto is an accident waiting to happen. In spite of my issues with the room, it is still a pretty decent hotel for Paris. The location can't be beat, it is attractive, and the staff was pleasant. I did not use the concierge service. I have stayed in other hotels in Paris and aside from the ergonomic complaints, this one is definitely one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend enough!”
Reviews.Author: mku4440
Reviews.Content: As most of the other reviewers state, hard to beat the location of this hotel! Beautiful hotel. Great, friendly staff. The rooftop terrace and Happy Hour bar were a wonderful surprise! The views from the rooftop are wonderful...sunset just behind the Eiffel Tower! My ONLY complaint is the door to the bathroom. It is a frosted glass swinging door, which means you hear EVERYTHING going on in the bathroom. No privacy when needing to use the toilet. :( Our friends are visiting Paris in July and I'm highly recommending this hotel to them.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: kakowNy
Reviews.Content: As the other reviewers have stated, the location is just great. A few steps off the St. Michel metro station, exit 2. It is in the middle of everything in the Latin Quarter. Very convenient to Notre Dame, Louvre, etc. Check in was a breeze. Got upgraded to a corner room with the view of the Eiffel Tower. The room was a little small, but in Parisian and New York standard, it's perfectly fine. The decor was very modern with dark furniture and sleek lines. The little patio with a small table and seats were just so delightful. The bathroom is small, but the shower is one of the best I have seen in all the previous trips to Paris. It's a message shower with rain shower spray, torso and mid-section spray, and a handheld spray. After a long day of walking, the powerful streams sure feels good. The room was also very clean. The rooftop patio was also a welcome surprise. You do not see this often in major city hotels. It offers a panoramic view of Paris. Very nice spot to see the sunset. My wife and I will definitely return to this hotel again in the future if we were to stay in the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: missmetroAtlanta_ga
Reviews.Content: From CDG airport take the RER 8.60 euro. Get offat Notre Dame and walk approx. 2 blocks and you are at the most convenient hotel in Paris. We arrived at 8am and our room ws ready! The room is small but we had a balcony that gave us extra room. The staff was great and most spoke English. The rooftop view is worth staying at this hotel. Metro, restaurants, the Seine, St. Chappelle, Conciergie and Notre Dame are just out the door. Louvre a 10-15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for two reason: 1) prime location in Paris, 2) Priority club award point stay. First, I don't know if you can find a better location for exploring Paris. RER from CDG drops you off about 100 yards from the hotel. Metro stop is 50 yards from the door. Notre Dame, St, Chapelle and the Latin Quarter are outside your door. In the evening, you step outside and there is a non-stop (but quiet) party on the streets and in the cafes. The rooms were modern with excellent beds and baths. Front desk staff, while no more or less welcoming than your average French hotel got the job done. Though it was plenty lively outside, the room was very quiet. The bath room was a little weird; getting the shower running required you to solve a Rubick's cube puzzle of valves and there was a large window between the room and the shower...-Might be cool for crazy couples but a little off-putting for me and my teenage son. Breakfast was a scam we avoided at 19 Euro. There are two SBUX within a couple of blocks. Also, like most hotels in France, Internet costs money. Overall, a great place if your main goal is to see this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “A bit pricey but very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: priashok
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 with 2 young children and stayed for 2 days. The room was pretty small (may be normal in paris) which initially shocked us. The staff were however very helpful - the front desk staff on dity was almost waiting at the door when we arrived as I was aking her for directions on the phone after getting down at the RER station. We were also able to check in by 9.30AM as our flight arrived in the morning without any extra charge. The hotel is very close to a metro and cafes and that was a big plus. The breakfast spread was reasonable though there was no live station meaning you couldn't order anything specific.

Reviews.Title: “inadequate attention to the basics....like clean glasses and toilet paper”
Reviews.Author: Sam154943
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights, which required a 100% non-refundable prepayment. The room was well-appointed as far as linens and fixtures were concerned; however, despite being classified as a "King Bed Executive" it was very small, there was no drawer space and no place to store a suitcase. I had to ask the chambermaid for toilet paper and clean glasses, and when I went to the front desk to ask to speak to the manager, the front desk clerk refused access unless I told her why I wanted to speak to him.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenLeeds54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a 3 day break here and it was the best short break we have had for years this was due to 1 Staff being so Friendly and Helpful 2 Very clean hotel throughout. All the staff were helpful and polite and always at the front was a guy called Jean Philippe nothing was to much trouble for this guy and because of the help and advice he gave it made our trip to Paris so much more enjoyable. Thank you to all staff and especially to Jean Philippe

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JustinDrew
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn, Rue Danton is a very good hotel in jus the right area. There are narrow streets filled with bars, brasseries and creperies and other places to eat. The Metro is a 5 minute walk and if you run for fitness, the river bank is fantastic with more than its share of interesting sites. The rooms are good size for an inner city hotel that does not break the bank completely. The room decoration is stylish and any issues we had with anything were remedied immediately by the staff. If you are feeling tired after a long day walking, there are two movie theaters within 5 minutes walk that show English language movies with french subtitles (VO NOT VF)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: elianegermanos
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Notre Dame has an amazing location in the St. Michel area, seconds far from the metro station. Many restaurants and cafes surround the hotel and the famous Latin Quarter is a walking distance away. Also the astonishing Notre Dame is minutes away. The breakfast was very good and the rooms are very stylish and modern. However, they are a bit unpractical and the beds are a bit small (queen size) for couples. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good for solo travel”
Reviews.Author: Suomessa
Reviews.Content: A fresh looking, modern hotel, which ticks all the boxes for business use if you have an executive size room. Otherwise, the desk is quite cramped on not really comfortable to stay in for any extended period of time. Bathrooms are clean but tiny as well - you can't swing a mouse let alone a cat. Breakfast is quite decent. There is a enough to choose from to find something you like, whether it is bread, dairy, cereals or hot foods. On the down side, internet is not free and the lobby bar seems to have had its atmosphere surgically removed. There is no fitness center either. Location is great. Notre Dame is around the corner and there are loads of restaurants within a short walk. My overall feeling was that it is a good hotel. I would stay there again. However, if you want that bit of Paris magic, you won't find it at the hotel itself. Often fresh, modern design tends to be a bit lacking in soul and that is the case here. But, for business when traveling alone, it is quiet and ensures that you won't have anything important to complain about. For me, traveling on business, I consider that a win.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Rooms in average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: globusat
Reviews.Content: First of all: the hotel is situated in a perfect area close to metro and rer stations in the middle of a vivid neighborhood. Now to the hotel itself: At check-in (at 2pm) our room was unheated (outside temp. -4°C) when complaining about the chilly room we were told to wait some minutes, the room should heat up shortly. After 15 minutes, the ac still blowing cold air into the room, we demanded another room. Check-in clerk and front desk manager were extremly unfriendly and it took us a lot of time and arguments to finally get another room. The room itself is very stylish but also very unpracticable. Between bathroom/toilet and main room you will find a big window so privacy is in no way given. This as well as the smallness of the room makes it more favourable for single use than as a double.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped”
Reviews.Author: neilevan
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of recent reviewers of this hotel I was happy with the great location, staff and cleanliness of the hotel. I was attending a conference in the hotel over a weekend on a B+B basis for two nights but the real let down was the actual size and layout of the room itself. Room 316 was situated behind a common entrance door leading to two separate bedrooms, these were located in the very corner of the building and given the odd shaped buildingsm in Paris this led to a very cramped room layout in 316. While I am a big fan of modern and mimimalist hotel rooms this one went a bit too far with light switches which had double actions, press the top of the switch for one set of lights and the bottom of the same switch for a different set of lights... if you can follow that! The air conditioning/heater controls were a trial in themselves and I had to reluctantly admit defeat and call the front desk to have someone come up and show me how to operate the controls, this was done almost instsntly and with good grace by a young man from reception. The layout of the room meant the bathrooom was shoehorned into whatever space was left, which wasn't much, the hand basin was wedged between the bathroomm door and the shower cubicle with not an inch/centrimetres to spare. There were no shelves to store the normal toiletries or a shaving bag, the complimentary shampoos/gels were perched on top of the handbasin which left no room for even a bar of soap. The chambermaid did store some of my esentials on top of the hairdryer along the bathroom wall, this space was also being shared incidentally be a hand tissue container. The wardrobe was crammed into the space leading into the cramped bathroom, all in all it would seem they crammed two standard bedrooms into a space perhaps best suited to a Suite or Executive Room. Now none of the above was life threatening or very serious just annoyances when you should have been able to get done what you needed to instead of being frustrated. The bed and pillows were ok for my tastes and I didn't use the mini bar or safe, the room cleaning was spot on and unobtrusive. One major plus was the provision of a British style three pin wall socket beside the work desk. The breakfast was the usual fare of hot and cold selections very well presented and kept refreshed constantly, as others have said there didn't appear to be a cafe/restaurant as such, perhaps with so many pavement eateries surrounding Paris there is no need. Supposedly all hotel rooms in Paris are small but this room was claustrophobic to the point of being off putting, for location, accessibility and public transport the hotel is excellent but when you can't turn around in the room without feeling you are enclosed it's just not comfortable. Overall if I had had to pay the quoted €190 per night for this room to my mind it was poor value, I am a long standing member of the Holiday Inn Priority Club and very seldom find any criticisms of the brand. Incidentally there is a terrific Irish Pub called Corcorans almost right beside this hotel, turn left out of the hotel and take the second left to find the Pub just up on your right hand side, for those who enjoy home comforts, like Irish food and drink, this place was the real deal with every possible sattelite channel to watch whatever sport you fancied. For all those culture vultures rolling their eyes up to heaven let me assure you I am no big fan of Irish Pubs abroad but if you were all sight seeing drained out and fancied a lazy couple of hours watching football with a few drinks and very reasonably priced food this was the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “There is other choices”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler13Usa
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a stay. Like many of said, the front desk staff is very poor. I found them not very responsive or helpful. As a Platinum member I was put in a handicap room which I was not not happy about. The shower was in the middle of the room with a curtain around it. When you took a shower, the bathroom was basically flooded. The big plus about this hotel is the location, but I did see a really nice Best Western, where we will stay next time. This hotel is not worth the 300 euro a night. Sadly, the poor service and staff has taken this place down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Cramped Room with no Shelving in Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParis
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Notre Dame Paris—Room 205—Dates of Stay 6-8 January 2011 We arrived around 3 pm, 15h, and were promptly greeted as Platinum members. I was upgraded to an executive room with King Sized Bed and Sofa Bed. My booking was with points for a room with two twin beds. There was a large flat screen tv with many channels-mostly French but with news channels in English, French, and Arabic. There was one Spanish channel but no German channels. There was a work desk with outlets and plug in for internet cable, a lamp and chair, and a small round table between bed and desk. There was a minibar with items fairly priced for large city, but we only used it to keep some sandwiches and a soft drink. One had to put key in slot by door for electricity. The heat and a/c were individually controlled and both worked in January. We needed air since we couldn’t open windows, and it was muggy. We didn’t unfold sofa bed so no comments on its comfort. There was a small swiveling chair in corner by window. There were two bedside tables: one with phone and both with stereo speakers. All lights could be controlled from each bedside and from entry, but oddly enough, not from bathroom or desk even for those lights. There was a closet with hangers and decent sized safe. There was an area between bureau and refrigerator with several ledges, two of which had kettle and supplies for tea, coffee, and hot chocolate. Bathroom had toilet, sink, and shower. Shower had rain head plus side sprays and a shower cord. Pressure was low if using more than one. Sink had weird control that made it hard to determine if hot or cold. Water pressure varied with temperature, but the quality was good. Toilet flushed very well and was used often since both of us were sick from too much raw seafood and fish in Marseille-I think one must have to develop the stomach for the many sea creatures. For this reason, we never ate breakfast so can’t comment except to say buffet was 19 euros and continental breakfast in bar was 9 euros. One major issue with bathroom was no shelving and no ledges. We had to use work desk for our toiletries and such. Sofa made room cramped. I guess if it had not been an executive room, then there would have been no sofa bed, no safe, and no minibar, but I think the only difference was those items in the same sized room thus too much furniture in room. Room was quiet for most part-we were on 2nd floor with traffic on Rue Denton outside, but there were double windows-one could be opened by firefighters in case of emergency, but no real view except street. The first morning, they tried to enter room to check mini bar even though sign on door to not enter! Since my notebook computer had no connection for internet cable, I was told I could purchase wifi for 5 euros/24 hour period but could only use in bar/lobby area. The cable at the lowest speed was the same as the wifi pricewise. Being the curious doubter than I am, I left my computer on and returned to my room after checking my email in the lobby, and it worked perfectly so I used the wifi in my room the rest of the time. I did have to get another password the second day. Hotel has observation deck which offers many great views of taller monuments in Paris such as Sacre Couer, the Eiffel Tower, Montparnasse, Notre Dame, etc. It was cloudy the night we went up but still beautiful. Staff made up mostly of young, handsome men who provided great service, spoke great English, but who always seemed to be on the phone so you had to wait 10-30 seconds each time. A wake–up call was requested the last morning and personally received on time-no recording. There were plenty of towels including two large ones. Since we were both sick, we slept until noon and didn’t leave the room until 2 pm the first day except I did make a quick jaunt to the post office 100m away from the hotel (right out the door of hotel) on Rue Danton towards Odeon. We left the Do Not Disturb sign on door until we left, but when we returned 2 ½ hours later, the room had not been cleaned. The young man at the front desk said our sign had been on the door until the past hour, but I said that it had been off since just before 2 pm. He said they would still clean our room, and I asked how late that could be done. He didn’t provide specifics so I requested 7 pm since we had a dinner reservation just after then. He said no problem, we stopped by to reconfirm as we were leaving, and the room was cleaned with completely restocked supplies and towels on our return 2 ½ hours later. We received two bar coupons because of my Platinum status but did not use since we were sick most of the time. Check out was smooth and accurate. There was a young lady there then, and we conversed entirely in French. The young men almost always responded in English. The lobby was spacious and clean with the bar, but as I said, we didn’t use our drink coupons. In summary, the location can’t be beat! I am only giving it a 4 because the room was cramped, the lack of shelving in bathroom, the ignoring of the “We’re sleeping” sign, etc. I found the hotel to be priced higher than it deserved, although I used points and only had to pay 10 euros at checkout for the 2 days of internet usage, which should have been free to Platinum Priority Club member. I probably wouldn’t stay here if I had to pay the rates I saw on line. Points come in handy at times! If I were staying in that area of town and paying, I would stay elsewhere to get more for less.

Reviews.Title: “Book this for locations and views”
Reviews.Author: have2seetheworld
Reviews.Content: I thought this was the perfect property for what we wanted. The locations is perfect if you want to be close to the famous sites. The views on the top deck of the property are truely amazing and worth every penny to stay here....5* view. We stayed in a standard Eiffel Tower view room. The room was small but expected. Loved the little porch. The room was modern and everything you would expect in a 3*. Our bathroom was fine....better than a lot of other 3* properties in Europe....being new and modern helps. I have stayed at many hotels around Europe and if you want a great 3* in Paris this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Looked great but---”
Reviews.Author: FredBirmingham1
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we stayed at this Holiday Inn and to be honest it will be the last. I still rate the Holiday Inn as a brand, just not this hotel. The location was great, the staff were good and helpful, but the room looked great but when you came to use the sink in the bathroom you discover it can hold very little water. There was very little space in the bathroom and a definite lack of work-surface to set anything on. There was a nice feature in the wall between the bathroom and the bedroom, it was a panoramic window which had a pull down blind which you could still see through!! On our second day there the room was spotlessly cleaned. The third day the tea cups had not been changed and there was still rubbish on the floor. I suppose it was New Year's day. The room was an Executive Room for three adults, myself, my wife, and our daughter. The wardrobe space was 8 hangers which faced forward and a shelf. The rest of the space was taken up with the safe and dressing gowns etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel, value somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: scintilla1980
Reviews.Content: It is a good 3 star hotel. Service is minimal but sufficient. Location is perfect, right outside of RER station exit 3/4. Room is clean but design is not user-friendly. Shower tap is too far to reach if you want to open it from outside of the tub, because of the glass door. Glass door is too narrow, water can splash to bathroom floor. Tap over the basin is almost impossible to open when your hands are wet which is usually the case. Service is not terrible, but I was astonished when I tried to ask he receptionist to bring network cable to my room politely. The answer I got is "absolutely not!". He could have just said no. It is not a five star hotel anyway. everything else is ok. Overall not value for money. But if you redeem free nite by points like me, it's good.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: RosaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, in the middle of all restaurants / bars and close to the Seine and centre. Staff is young, at first site a little cranky but there are very friendly. Standard rooms are a bit small, butt very nice, cosy and modern. You can pay a 35 Euro extra for the Eiffel Tower View, do it! Ask for a room on a high floor (6 or 7), the view over the Paris roofs makes it really special. There is a nice balcony. Room 711 is a nice standard eiffel tower room, its a corner room and has a extra large balcony and you can see the eiffel tower when you are taking a shower. Rooms are very expensive, better booking in front on there internet and pay less (175 euro for standard room incl. breakfast, 35 extra for the view).

Reviews.Title: “Quite expensive.Rooms poor Paris style”
Reviews.Author: TheLing
Reviews.Content: The location of this nhotel is very good and that is all it has and you pay for it, badly. The room I had was dark and small, I didn't feel comfortable there and the reception seems disorganized. Unless you want to stay in the area you'd better look for another cheaper hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hundredalto
Reviews.Content: This summer I spent a wonderful week staying at the Holiday Inn Notre Dame. I have been to Paris a number of times and this was my first time staying near the Latin Quarter. The hotel staff was friendly and very willing to answer any questions. My mother who speaks no French had no difficulty communicating with staff either. Each day the room was cleaned and fresh linens were provided. One of the gems of this location is the rooftop terrace. I highly recommend heading up there with a latte to watch a sunset over the city. This hotel is also in a prime location. It is convenient to many delicious cafes and restaurants. The Sorbonne University, Pantheon, Jardin des Tuilleries, and Notre Dame are all within short walking distance. Also the RER C and metro are located almost right out the front door and will take you anywhere you want to go for sightseeing or shopping. Also if you are looking to skip the mini-bar prices, there is a market located next door that sells beverages, snacks, and fresh fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean rooms, so so service”
Reviews.Author: travel2008Chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in October of 2010. The locations is excellent! lots of restaurants near by.very .close to metro stations (atleast 4). This area is always happening especially late at night..which we really liked..we had stayed at the Montparnasse area for 2 nights..and everything there (restaurants, pastry shops) tends to shut down early. Really nice location..rooms are small (typical of Europe). The service is not that great. Breakfast is expensive...its good if they refill the food (the holidayy Inn at Montparnasse was not very good at refilling the food at breakfast either) We ate breakfast at the hotel..b/c it was convenient. Great location though...I will probably stay here again b/c of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location - great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: giaboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there at the end of Paris and just loved the exectuive hotel room we got which had the balcony! Hotel was brand new and everything was clean and neat ...I loved our room and the modern ammenities. The roof top terrace is a thrill ...staff is friendly and you simply CAN NOT beat the location. We will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, new property”
Reviews.Author: flacpa01
Reviews.Content: Great location in Latin Quarter means we walked everywhere--Louvre, Notre Dame, Champs-Élysées, student area, etc. Didn't eat in hotel, but they recommended two fine restaurants for dinner. The bathroom has a window to the room that can be sort of covered but provides questionable privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great New hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OkanaganGirl154933
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms are small, this hotel is definitely worth staying at, if only to experience the AMAZING shower!! The bedding was plush and comfortable, the staff was helpful, and the roof top was wonderful and not to be missed... our last night in Paris we went up and said good night to the beautifully lit Eiffel tower with a glass of wine. The location is fantastic - short walk to the latin quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Prebbletonite
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights Room 804. I was very nervous about booking any hotel in Paris, as I have heard some real horror stories so I decided to go with a chain I knew to start our Europian holiday.I review this on the room we had as I know all room can vary! This hotel has a perfect location, the staff speak English better than I do French and they were welcoming when we arrived. Our room was spacious( a great relief) the bathroom was modern and it was spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and was one bed not 2 singles pushed together. The balcony with views of the Tower, Notre dame, Patheon , and most of the main attractions in Paris was wonderful, however don't worry if you don't have a veranda, as they have a roof terrace where you can see all that Paris has to offer day and night.It's magical up there. All the staff were friendly and helpful. It is a modern hotel but not over the top trendy like some,The room was very quiet and we found it very relaxing. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel so I cannot help you there but I confident it would be fine. The hotel is a five minute walk to Notre dame, 2 minutes to the metro and a beautiful half hour walk along the river to the tower, passing the louvre and many other main attractions. We were sad to leave and will definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamPlatinum
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and new hotel in one of the most interesting areas of Paris. Very close to a big metro/RER train station; close to Notre Dame Cathedral; just a few steps from the elegant St Germain Boulevard and inside the nice Quartier Latin. Unfortunately, I had a major issue during my staying: I had a reservation for an executive room, but I was put in a standard one. At the check out, I had to pay for the executive, as stated in the reservation. I had no time to argue due to my flight time, so let it be. Beware: the youth staff may not be prepared. Pros: location, cleanliness, very nice continental breakfast; staff of the breakfast Cons: strange room decoration, no privacy in the bathroom (there´s only a glass window between the room and the bathroom), small standard room, staff of the reception desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for an Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mehrdadnb
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through it's website for a business event and since I am a gold member of Priority Club I was expecting early check-in & upgrade benefits that are promised but due to some overbooked situation I received none. The Hotel itself is quite new , very clean with modern and nice atmosphere. The room was good and very clean. The sleep quality was excellent.The breakfast was nice and the choice of items seems to be sufficient for a 3 star hotel. I found the staff to be very polite and very very helpful during my stay. There is a strange window between bathroom & bedroom putting you in a funny situation when you are taking a shower but I did not find any clue about the concept of this innovation ! Location is PERFECT .Metro (& RER) station is couple of walks away and the neighborhood is full of shops,cafe & restaurants in a genuine Parisian style. During my stay , since there were two major exhibitions in Paris and every hotel was packed with visitors, the rates were ridiculously high and to be honest this hotel does not worth +400 Euros per night .If you were lucky to find better rates some other time,it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function”
Reviews.Author: SATraveller40
Reviews.Content: At the outset I must say that we booked this hotel due to the excellent reviews on this site and used credit card points. We arrived on a Sunday after a long flight from Vienna (don't ask). Upon check in we asked the indifferent desk attendant if they had a record of our voucher for the hotel. She ignored the question and just said that we had a special rate that she was not familiar with, and then assigned us to a room (#516). We are accustomed to small Paris hotel rooms as we have traveled there annually for 20 years, but this one took the cake. It was more like a closet than a hotel room. There were no drawers, and there was inadequate shelf and cupboard space. The closet itself had 8 hangers and a safe at the bottom of the closet, so the net effect was that anything longer than a blazer hung on top of the safe. If you are staying any longer than overnight, you will have a problem with storage. Then there was the bathroom. I know others have commented on this, but the entry way into the bathroom was 20 3/8 inches wide. Entry into the shower was 12 3/4 inches wide, and the sink area (which was wedged between the wall and shower) was 21 inches wide. So, even an average sized person would feel uncomfortable in this Lilliputian room. We had to go in and out of the shower sideways. I thought there might be an issue with the bill, so the day before check out I asked for a copy of our account to date. Just as expected, we were being charged for the room. Luckily the only hospitable and helpful person we had found at the desk was on duty. His name was Benoit and he was able (after 2 phone calls to the US) to sort out the situation for us and the charges were removed from the bill. Benoit was exceptional and I don't know what we would have done without him. Unfortunately his colleagues were not (perhaps it was the fact that their job is made more difficult by the horrible and uncomfortable design for the front desk where staff must stand for the entire time they are there). Finally, if you need Internet access and did not bring your own computer it costs 3 euro for 10 minutes of computer use. The computers were broken for the first 2-3 days of our 4 day stay and there was no sign to indicate that. The hotel is new, modern, beds are comfortable, location is good, and it is clean. However, this is not enough to make up for the overwhelming negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Executive Room a bit strange, but nice”
Reviews.Author: JCDKAD
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights total at the Holiday Inn - Notre Dame. Our first two nights were free, which was great considering the price of the room. The free room was upgraded, even better, to an Executive Room. The room was large, with a nice size bathroom. The strange part is the shower/tub. It had a picture window looking out into the rest of the room. The window had a shade so you could have privacy while showering; however, the shade had to be opened from the room side of the shower, not the bathroom side. Thankfully, it was my husband and I sharing the room, so I wasn't too concerned about this, but could imagine how it could be a problem for business people traveling together and sharing the room. The last three nights were in an Eiffel Tower View room - while the room was smaller and the bathroom much smaller, the extra cost is well worth the view.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start .....?”
Reviews.Author: travelling123_10
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the short list - the pros. Hotel was very well located, rooms were clean and quiet, lovely rooftop deck. Now, the cons. Right from the beginning the hotel staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful. The room we were given smelled like a sewer - they obviously have some kind of problem with their bathroom drains as this seemed to be where the problem originated. Their solution was to come and pour some kind of "perfume" down the drain to mask the problem. Didn't work for more than a few hours before the nauseating smell returned. When we asked to change rooms, they begrudgingly switched us to a different room - even smaller than the first. I figure this was their way of 'punishing' us for complaining. As others have noted, the bathrooms are extremely small and inefficient. On three separate occasions the room key wouldn't work as it lost its magnetism. Hotel staff tried to blame it on our cell phone - which we didn't even have with us. The final straw was when I got locked out of my room in my pyjamas and had to go down the elevator, through the lobby to the front desk to get them to re-magnetize my key for the third time. Prancing through the lobby of a Parisian hotel in my pj's is certainly not a memory I was hoping to have! The breakfast was very expensive (19 euros) and the quality just wasn't there. Would recommend going to one of the many nearby cafes or pastry shops instead. I would definitely not return to this hotel if I should ever be so fortunate as to return to Paris, which is truly an incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor room design”
Reviews.Author: Sarcastic_Travel
Reviews.Content: The good: The location is great. Half a block from the St. Michel Metro stop and a very short walk to Notre Dame and the Seine. We loved the location. The hotel was very quiet with sound-insulated windows. The beds were comfortable and everything was super clean. The bad: other reviewers have noted the rooms are just not functional. We were in a handicap room which was even worse. No counter space at all. The bathroom was the shower. Meaning - you walked into the bathroom and there was a shower head over a drain in the floor. Standing there you could reach the sink and the toilet. While showering, there was no place to put toiletries so I had to put them in the sink (no counter space around the sink). Due to the design of the bathroom, everything got wet and only one person could use it at a time. We were only there for three nights and we managed, but I wouldn't recommend for business travelers or for vacationers who need a little space to hang clothes and bathroom space to place items.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, average for business”
Reviews.Author: Johpess
Reviews.Content: This hotel charges incredible high rates just for the fact that it is near Notre Dame, we payed 300 euro per room per day, no internet for free, no breakfast included. For that rate it is better to chose a 5 star hotel instead that this average,pretentious 3 star. We checked in at 5 pm but our rooms were not ready, we had to wait until 6, they offered a drink. The bath tub had a problem with the drain, the water couldn't flush properly. The room is quite hot< even in september. I found the decoration quite dark, a lot of black and white light. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice area, but not very accessible with scooter”
Reviews.Author: jts1948
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent, room was clean, staff excellent, location perfect close to the Louvre and Notre Dame, the rooftop terrace was amazing. the biggest problem was entering and exiting with a wheelchair or scooter, in order to get in I as the able bodied person had to go into the hotel and go to the service elevator and bring it up 1 floor and open a door for the disabled person to come in and then use the service elevator to our room. The only advantage was that we were very close to our room with the service elevator. the whole ordeal was unnecessary and demeaning to the disabled person and would be very difficult without an able bodied partner. Wireless internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “WOW- loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbiecooper
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris. I travel all the time for work and have been in several countries outside the US. This hotel is brand new - 6 months old - and boy, it was really nice. It is close to all the major sites - Notre Dame, Louvre, Orangerie, Musee D'Orsay, and is an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower. It is very clean, modern, and the desk personnel were wonderful. No problems at all during my 3 day stay. I ordered a cab to CDG my last day and that arrived with no problems at all. The bed was so comfortable - the best I had in 2 weeks in France!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: mrose414
Reviews.Content: I would be hard put to find a reason to stay anywhere else in Paris. The hotel was clean, has two elevators, good bathroom, comfortable bed, stylish decor and above all else, a fabulous location. It is steps away from Notre Dame, Boulevard St. Michel, Boulevard St. Germain, Cluny, Les Deux Magots, the Metro and RER. It isn't too far from a Batobus stop, either.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable; great location!”
Reviews.Author: jcd016
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 nights - 2 nights using reward points, and 3 nights that we paid for. The hotel has been open as a Holiday Inn for 6 months, and they apparently did a complete renovation of whatever was there before, because everything was very modern. For the 2 free nights, we had booked a queen leisure room, but none were available, so we were upgraded to a king executive room. The room was fairly large (for Europe) with air conditioning. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was pretty cool with a large shower that could shoot water from above, straight ahead, or through a removable hose, or any combination of the above (although the drain couldn't keep up with multiple options for very long). Privacy in the bathroom might be an issue for some--There was a huge window between the bedroom area and the shower (with the rest of the bathroom in clear view beyond the shower). There was a shade for this window on the bedroom side where someone using the bathroom had no control. Also the bathroom door was a sliding door made of frosted glass. Stay here with someone you love. For the 3 paid nights, we were in a room with an Eiffel Tower view. This room was smaller and much more conventional, but still very modern and comfortable. The only negative was a tiny bathroom sink with no counter space. The room had a small balcony with a couple chairs and had a clear view of the Eiffel Tower. We saw an amazing sunset. I would say the view is worth the extra cost. Hotel breakfast was good, but not worth 19 Euros when there are so many cafes in the area. The lobby area was nice, and the staff was very good. Elevators were very good, which isn't that common for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for First Timers”
Reviews.Author: flannan
Reviews.Content: As a first timer I couldn't have made a better choice!! You are a block from the Seine and a bridge length from Notre Dame. The Metro station St Michel also serves RER B & C for both CDG airport & a trip to Versaille. St Germaine includes both walkable high-end shopping one way (a far less crowded Louis Vuitton than Champs Elysee) and lower cost shopping (Zara,etc) the other way; also 2 blocks to a Monoprix supermarket). Rooms have a small fridge and their is a small shop next door for drinks and great fruit. Other posters have shown the absolutely stunning views from the roof deck. That alone is worth the price of the room, which was excellent value. The added bonus, the room has a small balcony for two. Ask for a room on the front side of hotel as I didn't see balconies in the rear. There are numerous cafes in every direction and you are also steps to the beginnings of the Latin Quarter for less costly meals if that's your choice. The beds were fantastically firm and pillows great. We slept like babies. While you're in a busy area, it was surprisingly quiet with the balcony door and windows closed. Only downside was the bathroom. We had a shower stall only, which is fine, but the room itself is tiny and the modern style of sink leaves no room (or shelving) to hold any of your belongings. Also, I'm a pretty small woman and I actually split my elbow ,whacking it on the shower stall, while trying to dry off. There is literally only enough room to turn around. It was pristine as far as cleaniliness though. Hotel staff were very friendly and welcoming. All in all, the location and access to so much so close really helped make our first time to Paris wonderful. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Knowing what to expect, this hotel is exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: citoyennea
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel the last few times I've gone through Paris and it is my favorite. When I went through Paris the last time, the hotel was completely booked and I stayed at a "4" star hotel which was worse than the Holiday Inn. Enough people have talked about the location. It's all true. The staff is pleasant. I arrived at 6am and I was given a room. The first time I stayed, I was upgraded to an executive room, then I stayed in a regular room with a balcony and view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are small, but all rooms are small in France. I wouldn't spent weeks in this hotel as there is not a lot of storage space and the wardrobe is small, but then again, you should not be spending all of your time in the hotel room since there is so much to do within close proximity to the hotel! My only complaint is the awkward placement of the window in the bathroom in some rooms. There is a window directly looking into the bathtub. I'm not sure why they placed it there. The rooftop deck is lovely and if you are able to get a room with a balcony, you can sit for hours and sometime between midnight and two am, the Eiffel Tower has a "light show" where it dazzles and dances and you have the perfect view. I did not eat breakfast there as there are so many cafes within 5 minutes where you can sit and have breakfast. The room is clean, the beds have the pillow top comfort that I love and many rooms have the BOSE iPod charger sound system. It was a very pleasant stay. I hope to be able to stay there next time when I go through Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel 10/10 for everything!!”
Reviews.Author: eddie8105
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel some months ago for 3 nights to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. After a pretty hairy taxi ride from the Gare du nord train station we arrived at the hotel. I had asked at the time of booking, if we could have a complimentary upgrade due to our anniversary, and sure enough we had been upgraded to an executive room with a balcony and eiffel tower view (room 807) at no extra cost (I will be forever grateful, thank you). The room was simply fabulous, Large flat screen TV, Bose I pod/phone dock, great shower, Gowns/slippers, Mini bar and even a UK socket! A French window opened out onto a large balcony with furniture and a stunning view of the city, simply gorgeous - see pics. My only criticism would be the the bed and duvet, the bed was a little too soft and the duvet far too warm. Staff were very helpful and spoke perfect english. Breakfast was excellent with a great selection of hot and cold food. The location of this hotel is one of the best in Paris, you walk out one way and are immediatley surrounded by bars and cafes, walk another and some of best shops in paris are at your disposal, and the metro is a 2 minute walk away. We had a great time at this hotel and would highly recommend it to all!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms definitely not designed by a woman!”
Reviews.Author: KBScotland
Reviews.Content: Lovely new hotel in fantastic location, my only gripe would be that the rooms are definitely NOT designed by a woman - very poor lighting making it almost impossible for us girls to put on our make up, no drawer space, very little hanging space and what there was was restricted in length by the in-wardrobe safe (so no good for dresses etc), nowhere to put your toiletries in the bathroom, either by the sink or when having a shower. Can't comment on value for money as this was a couple of reward nights through Priority Club. Avoid the very touristy area near the hotel, turn right when leaving reception and head down that direction, much nicer. Would return if we could get a good deal but definitely wouldn't pay the full whack for the room that we had. Oh, one major plus point - fabulous roof terrace with 360 deg view of Paris, surprisingly better during the day than at night. Had a problem with our booking prior to arriving in Paris, however the hotel fixed it very quickly to our satisfaction with no problem. Quiet hotel at night, taking into consideration the central location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location Holiday Inn Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: PacMan2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a winner from all standpoints and we stayed here thanks to the previous tripadvisor reviews. We stayed in an executive room for six nights and highly recommend the hotel. It is under a year old and is very clean. The shower and water pressue is excellent. The executive room is small in comparison to U. S. rooms but it is a well organized room. We stored our suitcases straight up under the desk. There is a mini bar which can be used for beverages and other items which can be purchased right next door to the hotel in a small grocery store. There is a roof top area with tables and great views of Paris. This hotel is two blocks from Notre Dame cathedral and is a block from major metro lines and rail connections and is located on a side street. Excellent restaurants within walking distance. One metro station from Luxembourg gardens and within walking distance to Seine boat rides and the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: medical154
Reviews.Content: The holiday inn was in an absolutely excellent location in the latin quarter. The rooms were small, but very clean and nicely designed. Beds were very comfortable, with a choice of pillows according to preference. The rooms were quiet at night and we were not disturbed, despite the central location. The staff on the front desk were very helpful. Given the cost of hotels in Paris generally, this was value for money. Our only issue with our stay was that our room was cleaned only once in our three night stay. Refreshments too were only topped up once.

Reviews.Title: “Wow can't wait to return.”
Reviews.Author: GFinchum
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris. Rooftop view was more than we hoped for. Viewed city, day, night, and at sunrise. Metro is almost out the front door. The Louvre and Cathedral Notre-Dame are within easy walking distance. For you Priority Club members, use your points. They go further considering the exchange rate from the dollar to euro.

Reviews.Title: “HArd To Find Fault”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth Holiday Inn we have stayed in, ranging from the very poor Holiday Inn Midtown New York (give us a tip but don't expect a smile) to the excellent Hotel at Niagara Falls and the warm welcome of Holiday Inn Solihull (UK) but this one beats them all. This is a new hotel hewn from an old building. It is light, airy and spotlessly clean. We have stayed in over half a dozen hotels in Paris and in our opinion this one stands out from the rest. The bedroom although quite small is well appointed, the bathroom something rather special with a great powerful shower (bath available too) and the largest shower head we have ever seen. If I were to make one criticism it's that the shower screen is a tad on the small size to deal with the volume of water it produces. The reception is welcoming (as were the staff). All in all, very different to find fault but so many positives. The only thing I was slightly uneasy about commenting on was value for money; we booked this on Holiday Inn Priority Club points (one of the few loyalty schemes where you actually seem to get something back) so we did not pay attention to what the price would have been. We hope others enjoy this hotel as much as us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic roof terrace”
Reviews.Author: glennharrold
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Location is great for RER direct from CDG , so you can get quickly from the airport to the hotel and enjoy your time in Paris. Metro also very close however the location is pretty much central so its easy to walk around the city. Our room was comfortable with a great bed and immaculately clean. Wet room shower room, trendy if a little impractical. Tea and coffee in room and plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Staff were friendly. Roof terrace was great for a view of Eiffel Tower, Sacre Coeur and Notre Dame. Would have no hesitation staying here again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was great, but the room stunk (literally)!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2019
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Paris-Notre-Dame. My husband and I traveled with our college age son and teenage daughter. Let's start with the positives: Very close to a Metro stop, many wonderful cafes, restaurants, bistros, etc in the area, walking distance to Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay. The staff was very helpful in finding a nice restaurant for a celebration dinner and gave great directions via the Metro to travel to other sights not within walking distance. Our children had a room of their own - an Executive room which was 2 twin beds as I requested. Their room was on the second floor, very nice with a small love seat and table. They were provided with bathrobes, shaving kit, toothbrush kit, bathroom scale. They were very happy with their room and the time I spent in their room was very nice. Now onto our room. We were on the 4th floor. The first thing we noticed when we entered our room was the odor - like stagnant dirty water. At first i thought this was due to the air conditioning being off. This hotel is very eco-friendly, which we really appreciated. To turn on the lights and AC, you put one of your key cards into a slot just inside the door. Then, when you leave and remove your card, all of the lights and AC turn off. We left for a short time to get dinner and returned to a still stinky room. Then we discovered that the telephone did not work. We could get calls in but could not call other rooms or even the front desk. We were not provided with bathrobes, a scale, or either of the kits that the other room had. The next morning, on our way out to explore Paris, I mentioned both the phone and the odor to a staff member at the desk. She assured me a technician would fix both issues. We returned at 7PM. The staff member on at that time was very helpful in making a reservation for us at a wonderful restaurant to celebrate my birthday. We went to our room to find that neither issue had been resolved. On our way out to dinner, we again mentioned these to the same desk staff who made the reservation. He said he would check into it personally. When we returned after a delicious dinner he told us a technician would need to look into the phone but that it was too late at night for that, and he would have someone look into the odor in the morning. It was difficult to sleep because of the nauseating smell. And, the telephone issue could have been a serious safety problem as we could not call anyone in case of an emergency. The next morning, I spoke to the same woman as the day before who said she would have someone look into the issues. At this point, I requested a new room and was told I would need to check back later. I called the hotel mid afternoon and was told that the phone was repaired and housekeeping would do something about the odor. When we returned from our day of sightseeing and went to the room, it smelled like a hint of roses in addition to the other stench! We again requested a different room. At this point we were given a nice room with a small balcony and a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower and Notre Dame. On a funny note, the bathroom partition (they don't really have bathroom doors, just frosted glass partitions) didn't close at all! And, the bathroom sink leaked, dripping onto the floor. Those issues really didn't affect our night, but for a hotel that was just opened 8 months ago, they have serious problems. And, according to the Tripadvisor review of hotel amenities (done by Expedia), the beds in this hotel were supposedly Sleep Number beds. They were not. We have one of these beds at home and can set your own "sleep number" based on how soft/firm you like your mattress. The beds at this hotel were very comfortable, but definetly not Sleep Number. The hotel does offer wi-fi, but only in the lobby area and for a fee. We could have gotten a cable to use in the room, but that was more expensive. We did not have breakfast at the hotel because it was too expensive and there are lovely cafes right in the area. I loved Paris, but for the price of this hotel, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location, spotless, modern”
Reviews.Author: Tangokid
Reviews.Content: Just back from our first trip to Paris and well pleased with our stay at this hotel. As we were expecting the rooms were small so we booked an executive room, no,614. Room spotless, bed one of the most comfortable we've ever slept in, balcony with a view of eiffel tower, superb air conditioning. The location of this hotel is second to none for access to the city and CDG airport are 150 feet from the entrance. Notre dame Cathedral just 5 mins walk, the Seine just 2 mins. Now the rooms are a little pricey but worth it for the location. Now to solve the issue which so many have said about the showers leaking onto the floor! The first shower I took spilled all over the floor, so I decided to investigate why. What they have done here is they have purposely almost blocked the shower trap with silicone and tape, resulting in the water draining very slowly and flooding the floor, in turn the guest will quickly turn off the shower and save the hotel on their water heating bill! Look, its a bit of cheap trick but that is the only little thing that I could say against the hotel. If you are looking for reasonably priced food I suggest Rue de Mouffetard, 10 min metro ride away or €6 taxi. There is a good selection of restaurants here. We had 3 course menu for €25 with Sole on the Bone as main course which is exceptional value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but Brits beware - you'll have trouble getting a cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: julie1961
Reviews.Content: You can't fault the location of this hotel - you are right in the centre of everything - but it's very quiet and you will get a good nights sleep. The Executive roms are very small and with a third person there is no room to move. Also there is a large window between the bathroom and the bedroom with a see-through blind for privacy (so there is none). This could be a problem depending on who you are travelling with. The bar in the hotel looks very inviting but the drinks are expensive so we didn't go in. We were there for 3 nights and never saw a single person in the bar. Presumably they would rather have it completely empty than lower their prices. However the worst shock was finding out that they didn't stock ordinary tea!! They had a huge range of fruit teas but really at breakfast you just want your standard cup of tea. We were told they no longer had it as they had a new range of teas. However we must have made enough of a fuss for them to have it on the 3rd day. Tip - if you like your tea take your own tea bags! Overall a really good location and we would definitely go back (with tea-bags!).

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION BUT REALLY DIDNT LIKE THE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Prodwell
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day trip to our favourite city in the world which is just as wonderful as I remember it from 2 years ago. When in Paris we always like to stay somewhere near St. Germain since although in August it is always buzzing with tourists it just has that feeling of Paris café society which most other capital cities lack. This trip, based in large part upon the Trip Advisor reviews I had read of the Holiday Inn Notre Dame, I decided to try it out and oh boy do I wish I hadn’t!!!!! Whilst as I say the location is great the rooms really are tiny and the layout not thought out at all.
