There is very little space to put anything down on a surface and in the wardrobe the hangers are the wrong way around and it is such a pain getting things in and out. I found the bed quite comfortable but sadly my partner didn’t BUT the pillows were most uncomfortable – just lumps of foam rubber. However the worst is yet to come – the bathroom (or rather shower room) which whilst at first glance looked OK it really didn’t function and the drains stank to high heaven. In the so called bathroom there were no shelves on which one could put ones toilet bag nor indeed anything at all and there was no towel rail for the hand towels and the towel rails for the bath towels and the hand towels (as there was nowhere else to put the hand towels) was so small the towels barely fitted. Also the wash basin tap whilst again looking good was a pain to work especially with wet hands, which of course was when one was using it. Next time Holiday Inn – spend more time and money on function rather than looks. All in all a definite NO NO for me and maybe for many others. Paris in the future – for ever – Holiday Inn Notre Dame in the future for NEVER!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brand new, clean, great location...(small rooms)...”
Reviews.Author: TSpitz
Reviews.Content: We are finishing up our stay in Paris and we're very happy with the location of the Holiday Inn. Right outside the door are countless cafes and bars with friendly, English speaking waiters and great food. The metro (which is easy to use for even the most hesitant traveler) is very safe, a two minute walk, and tthe easiest and cheapest way to get around paris. If you get to a station and the train has already left, another one isn't more than two minutes behind it. The staff are helpful with giving maps and circling directions where/ ever you need. All this being said, we thought it was interesting that it seemed like all the guests were American too! About the room...The hotel is brand spanking new with a quirky, modern look. For example, the motif of the entire hotel is magenta and black; the carpet in our room is even striped with those colors! We splurged for the executive room/king bed which basically means that we got a bigger bathroom because the bed is not a king at all by American standards, and the room barely fits our two large suitcases on the floor space. From what I understand, this is a good deal of room for paris compared to other hotels. The major plus about our room is the balcony! there are two large floor to ceiling windows that open up to a balcony with a table and chairs. We were told that we wouldn't be able to see the Eiffel Tower from our room, but we have th most amazing view of it. Just sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine in hand...a beatiful view. Also in the distance is the Arc de Triomphe but you have to strain a little to see it. Either way, the accommodations were perfect for us and we don't have any complaints...EXCEPT the internet situation. WiFi is only available in the lobby, and otherwise you can hardwire your connection in your room for between 5 and 15 Euros (depending on the speed you select). Since my husband had to work while we were here, this was not great. All in all, a great stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, ordinary service”
Reviews.Author: Ozzieflyer
Reviews.Content: We arrived prior to check-in time, soaking wet and hoping (not expecting) a room might be available. We were told we should come back around 1300 when a room might be available. When we did return, we were told no room was available and we’d have to wait until 1400. At other Holiday Inn hotels I have never experienced this - and despite being a Priority Club member (which I later discovered is worth nothing at this hotel), we felt we were treated with contempt - ie. how dare we arrive and expect a room would be available prior to 1400 (advertised check-in time). The girl on the front desk when we arrived was one of the rudest person's on a check-in desk we have ever come across. The housekeeping was appalling - coffee and milk was not replenished during our 4 night stay. Our Room (611) was small, bathroom was too small - and as others have written, there is nowhere to place toiletries. The shower recess is too small, meaning water spray goes all over the floor. Style over substance? View from room was good, view from rooftop terrace even better. The best thing about this hotel is the location - so many cafes and restaurants within easy walking distance, and plenty of souvenir shops also. It is close to Metro and RER. To be honest, these things are the hotel's saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,new,good location and good value!!! Simple hotel with a nice terrace”
Reviews.Author: erimleb
Reviews.Content: After we rented a house we need to stay 3 more nights in paris.We searched on expedia and found this hotel.Location is great 2 mins walk to subway.Hotel is very new inside,bed was comfortable,doesnt offer you many things,but you dont need much either.We stayed in a Eiffel tower view room.Balcony is small but nice you can see all the rooftops and eifell tower.Bathroom is small as well but romm and bathrooms were very clean.I didnt have any problem during my stay.Only thing is sometimes there are lack of staff were working in reception.But its not a big deal.Hotel has really nice terrace that you can drink some tea and look at the view. Price point was great ,when i compare with other hotels in the area.Nice simple and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, spring for the eifel tower view room”
Reviews.Author: jaybo89
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, easy access to metro. Wonderful roof top garden.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: richsedgewick
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel in the latin quarter. The staff was a bit young and a bit inexperienced (they had never heard of the Picasso Museum - we found out it was closed, but I was still surprised a hotel concierge had never heard of it...) The rooms are small but standard for Paris and overall the value of the hotel given the great location for sightseeing was excellent. I'd recommend for people on a first sightseeing visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic stay-such a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate518
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastically located: very close to Notre Dame, lots of good places to eat nearby, yet it's quiet in the hotel for sleeping. The rooms are very luxurious and the beds are very comfortable! Had one of my best night's sleep in a long time! The staff is very friendly and helpful. They let me check in early when I arrived, which I really appreciated. I wish the WiFi was free, that was my one complaint about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice new hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NationalParkFans
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-May - 2 nights on Points + cash and 2 nights AAA rate of ($200 USD - ouch). We had 2 singles that overlooked the quiet side of the hotel and rooftops. The Good: Loved the neighborhood! Clean and new Very comfortable beds Fun Decor Rooftop terrace Nice staff The Bad: -Bad smell in room and corridors (they had a problem with this and were spraying the halls for the smell). -Bathroom shade - there is a window in the bathroom that looks out into the room. They have a roll up shade that lets in light - however, at night you can see everything in the bathroom. Sorry, I don't want to use the bathroom and have people see me even if they are a close relative. I requested a sheet and we hung it over the window shade and all was fine. We just didn't understand why anyone would want a window here. -Bar was very expensive. Didn't use it but specialty drinks were advertised in the $15 to $20 Euro range. -Needs storage area in bathroom. No where to put cosmetics bags, etc. -Small rooms We didn't use the breakfast facilities (20 euros for breakfast) and instead went to the bakery just down the little street (very charming!) It was my first time in Paris and I loved this location and would stay here again. However, I felt it was too expensive for the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: InSFnow
Reviews.Content: Even though I liked this hotel, and I liked the surrounding area a lot, I'll have to say that on previous visits to Paris, I've stayed at cheaper and still better hotels. (Don't bother with the breakfast - it's not worth th effort and cost.) Ther was nothing really wrong with anything - I just think the hotel was overpriced. Consequently, I don't think I'll stay at this hotel on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Views from Rooftop....and A/C”
Reviews.Author: JJKTEXAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Notre Dame for two nights. We got two rooms for the three of us. One was a double...the other two singles. The rooms aren't large but were very functional. Both rooms were modern and really trendy...in a good way. The bathrooms were cool and clean. The general decor of the hotel is really trendy and attractive. The hotel is in the St. Michel area near the Sorbonne. Many restaurants and shops were within a block away. A small market is next door. The Metro stop was a block away. The hotel staff was wonderful at check-in and during our stay. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We generally had that experience with everyone in Paris--the visit was magical. The best thing about the hotel was the rooftop deckwith beautiful views of the city. You could have a snack or a glass of wine and take in the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame and the rest of the city from a 9th floor unobstructed view. DID I SAY THE HOTEL HAS REALLY GOOD AIR CONDITIONING? Paris was hot. We are from Houston and need our A/C. It was 85 degrees during the day. There was no way you could sleep well without A/C while we were there. Most hotels expect you to survive by opening up the windows at night. My husband was so proud of himself for finding this great hotel. It truly made the difference in our enjoyment of Paris. We sqeezed the visit into our trip, so our time was limited. The price was competetive since we are on the rewards program and made our reservations in advance. The area is convenient to everything. Even my 11 year old thought the rooms were the coolest we stayed in on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well situated, small rooms, hit or miss service, pricey”
Reviews.Author: purewaves
Reviews.Content: Pros - Excellent location, clean, well decorated premises, slightly above average bedding, good in room perks like a flat screen TV, minibar, and coffee & tea making facilities. Cons - Hit of miss service, poor value ($200 a night for a tiny room), almost no space for clothing storage, low quality (and expensive) internet service. This hotel is located steps from Notre Dame so it's quite central. It's located near a slew of eateries and pubs, as well as a metro stop, so anything you may want is within walking distance or quick public transport connection. Everything is well designed in the hotel, and it's got a modern, clean feel to it. The rooms have some significant positive which I should mention like the powerful and responsive cooling system (which was amazing), and an amazing bathroom, which was top notch and full of flashy features. They also give you nice little extras like a kettle with coffee and tea, a good quality flat screen TV, and a decently stocked minibar. On the downside, in comparison to most other international locations, the rooms are tiny. They also feature very little in the way of clothing storage space (a bit of a problem for 2 people staying multiple days). But for Paris, as everyone is brainwashed into saying, it's a normal size. I kind of got the feeling the standard rooms here were designed to give you just enough space to make you not complain, but not an inch more. Regarding the service, we felt that it was quite spotty . First, we asked for an 8am wake up call on our first day. It unapologetically came at 830am. No reason except that they forget. The room service also messed up a few times as well; we didn't get replacements for our toilet paper, and the towels were simply fixed up and straightened rather than changed. They also forget to do random, seemingly simple things, like leaving a bath mat, and changing the spoons after we used the ones we got for coffee. I also have to mention that the hotel internet service is poor quality and a bit of a rip off. They offer you various data allotments that range in price from 5 euros to 20 euros. The data you buy is allocated to 24 hour time-blocks and does not roll over. So, if you don't use your data allotment for that period you are out of luck. Also, even if you pay for internet in the room, you still have to pay to use the wireless internet in the lobby. Not exactly fair. You would think at 200 euros a night for a small, standard room, they would add in complimentary internet access, at the very least in the lobby. No such luck. It's quite mind boggling that this is their policy, especially when so many hotels nowadays are making it a free perk for guests. One final thing regarding the rooms; the value is a bit on the poor side. Yes, you get the great location and the new, clean room. But you will also pay about $200 a night for something that really amounts to a 2, maybe 3 star hotel. In comparison, we got a 5 star hotel in Berlin for about $150. Yes, Paris isn't Berlin, I know. But knowing that your paying so much for such a tiny space makes it feel like a rip off. Paris is always a tough place to find a good room at a good price. So, in the end, I do recommend this property. I should say, I don't recommend it because it's one of the best in it's class in the world, but simply because it's somewhat better than other hotels I've stayed at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Say Enough About Location”
Reviews.Author: bcrichter
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most of the previous reviews. The location of this hotel could not be any better. It is literally 150 feet from the entrance to the St. Michel Metro station which will provide access to almost any location in the city with a maximum of one transfer (also happens to be on the RER B line with direct service to the CDG Airport). In addition, you are seconds away from the bustling latin quarter, but you don't pay for it with noisy rooms at night. You could probably hit Notre Dame with a baseball throw from the roof of the hotel. To top it off, there's a convenience store next door that sells fresh fruit and all the essentials that you'll need in your room (i.e. toiletries, soda, beer, wine, snacks). Room: The room we had was great. All rooms in Paris hotels are small (with the exception of the super luxury hotels, but obviously you pay for that), so the size shouldn't surprise anyone. In the end it provides all the room necessary. The bed is very comfortable and unlike most hotels in paris, the bathrooms are quite modern and convenient. The only complaint we had about our room is that the door to the bathroom is sort of a restaurant kitchen sort of door opening in and out with no latch, detracting from privacy a bit. we opted to pay a bit extra for a room with a small balcony with views of the Eiffel Tour. The balcony was a great place to sit in the evening and have a drink before or after dinner. Service: I think it needs to be mentioned that while this hotel is incredibly comfortable and well equipped, people need to understand it is not a LUXURY hotel. The staff simply is not going to provide the same service as you might expect from the staff at a hotel of this price in the US or some other countries. Overall, we found the staff to be quite friendly. Having lived in Paris before, we didn't need much help in the way of restaurant advice, directions, etc., so I can't speak directly on this matter, but I did overhear the staff giving restaurant recommendations to other guests and they did not appear to take the time to inquire about the desires of those guests before recommending restaurants. They seemed to just provide recommendations of restaurants close to the hotel, which might not always have been best. So, take it for what its worth, but don't expect a dedicated concierge, because its not that type of hotel. Also, 20 euros for breakfast is highway robbery. Don't pay it as there are numerous options in walking distance with similar or better fare for far less. Amenities: The roof-top deck is really the highlight of the amenities. I can't imagine there are many other hotels at this price with similar decks. You have a panoramic view of the City highlighted by the Eiffel Tour, Notre Dame, the Pantheon and Sacre Coure. I highly recommend heading up there around midnight to see the Eiffel Tour sparkle at midnight. The hotel offers internet for a price and also has computer terminals in the lobby for a fee. There is also a full service bar. Summary: If you're looking for a comfortable, clean, modern hotel at a reasonable price and care more about location than status, this is your place. To be this close to all the great options on the Left Bank, Ille St. Louis and Ille de Cite' and not have a noisy bedroom is invaluable and they should be applauded for their work. We will definitely stay in this hotel again in the future and will recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden modern gem with AMAZING views of Paris”
Reviews.Author: catspat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and my parents (separate rooms) on their first trip to Europe. Spent a great deal of time researching hotels as most 3* were small and had awful decor...what a find this was! Positives - Beautiful modern decor with flatscreen TVs, minibar, table, air conditioning etc. - Comfortable beds - Roof top with fantastic views over paris, so romantic! - My parents had a room with a balcony so request one in a higher floor - Small rooms but normal for European standards - 30 seconds walk to St Michel metro, 5 mins to Notre Dame and about 10/15 walk to the Louvre. - Right next to a small convenience store - Walk to Latin quarter, pubs and the river - Explore the back alleys for some boutique cafes - Very safe people with lots of people walking around even late at night - Good service Negatives - Bathtub floor could be hazardous as quite slippery but that's really it! Would definitely stay here again. I have added pictures but keep in mind I am using a wide angle lens so it makes it look bigger than it is. We stayed in a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible!!!!! A hidden jewel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Confusie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in this hotel for one week and I cannot even express how wonderful it was! The location was perfect as it was within steps of one of the main Metro stations in the fabulous Latin Quarter, as well as the entire area was filled with places to eat or shop, and filled with lively and safe crowds of people to mingle with. The staff was excellent and extremely helpful as far as aiding us in making plans and navigating around the city. We were provided with a surprise upgrade to an executive suite which was HUGE by Paris standards - very contemporary decor, continually spotless, with a jacuzzi tub and very large balcony with a breathtaking view of the Eiffel Tower and Notre Dame. The rooftop garden was an added plus when relaxing after very long days sightseeing. Thanks to the entire staff who were awesome and made our stay the most wonderful week possible! I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone who plans to visit Paris!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hdelaespriella
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading some of the reviews on this site and we were not disappointed. The hotel is brand new and the location is superb. Very close to the St. Michel metro station (which by the way has a very helpful staff for buying the right metro ticket for your stay). The front desk staff at the hotel still needs a little bit of work, but they do their job and were very helpful to us in accommodating two rooms on the same floor. The rooms have a good size. We had an Eiffel tower view room (#711) and a regular room overlooking the street (#702). Room 711 is located next to the elevator but you would never know it, absolutely no sound, however we could hear sounds coming from the room next door, but nothing to complain about. This particular room has a different layout that other rooms because it is in the very corner of the hotel. The bathroom is large and has 2 large windows overlooking the Eiffel tower. The room has windows from end to end also overlooking the same view and since the bathroom door is frosted glass, you will get the light in the room at night. If you are looking for a dark room for sleeping, this is not it. The bed is queen size and very comfortable. Slept like a baby. There is a veranda that you can go out to with a small table and two low chairs. Very nice to take pictures of the surrounding area and sit around for a while. The only odd thing about this room is that there is a column dividing the room in two and it sits right next to the bed, but they have placed the flat screen tv on a wall that is on an angle so we could watch tv fine, not that we had any time to watch tv. By the way, they only have two channels in English (CNN international and BBC news). Room 702 is a square room, facing the street but you would never know it either as it is very quiet. Unlike 711, room 702 has one large window so closing the curtains will give you complete darkness. It gets dark very late in Paris in the summer, something to think about if you like to sleep in complete darkness. I found this room to be more comfortable than 711 as far as space is concerned because there were no weird angles. The bathroom is also a bit smaller and also has a frosted glass door. One of the tub/shower walls is frosted glass to let light in from the room window so privacy may be an issue. Both rooms have safes and are easy to use. You will need to slide your key card into a slot near the door in order for the electricity of the room to work, which means that when you leave, the air conditioning will stop working. However, the ac units here work very well and cool down these rooms very fast. They also have a cool "do not disturb" system where all you do is press a button on your door that lights up a red light on the front of the door that blinks. The hotel charges 10 Euros for wifi but it never worked for us on our iphones, so we got a credit at the end of our stay. They do have two computers in the lobby that you can check your email if necessary. It was not that expensive to use, we only paid around 6 Euros to check two email accounts in two separate occasions. The hotel has a bar and an outdoor section with tables but we didn't have much time to experience the amenities of this property, however everything here looked very clean and new. We booked this hotel with breakfast included. It is buffet style and includes scrambled eggs, sausages (which I heard people raving about them), bacon and potatoes. It also included an assortment of bakery items, fruits, juices, coffee, etc. The dining room staff was very attentive and there was a lot of room here with enough tables. I've heard some contrasting comments about breakfast at this hotel. We thought it was convenient, quick and easy, that way we didn't have to worry about finding a place to get something to eat, but there are so many bakeries in this city, that you would never go without food if you need to eat something. The biggest positive of this hotel is its location and proximity to the metro and the Notre Dame Cathedral. The Cathedral is a literally a short walk. You may also find it close enough to the Louvre but we were too tired to walk that far. The metro is fairly easy to use in Paris so taking one to the museum gets you in the door. You'll also find that the St. Michel line takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower and other famous attractions. The best way to experience the metro is to purchase a day pass that lets you use it all day without having to buy anything else. You'll need the ticket to enter the metro and exit it as well in some instances. Tip: There is a small store right next to the hotel if you want to buy some water, soft drinks, fruits or something to snack in the room. Since the rooms have refrigerators, we were able to keep our drinks cool all the time. There is also a nice restaurant on the same block of the hotel as you walk toward the St. Michel station. The food was great and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Mediocre service. Small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: stoprr
Reviews.Content: Best location for a clean modern room. Minutes from everything (metro, bus, food, attractions). Inexperienced staff. Not very useful or helpful when it comes to advice or concierge services. Nearly made us miss our flight. When we tried to book a taxi the night before, we were told that it was not necessary as a call in the morning 15 minutes before we needed to leave, would be sufficient. Next morning, there was a single clerk working the counter and she could not find a taxi or any transportation for that matter. And with more people waiting to check out, she lost interest in helping out. Finally had to rush to the nearby train station (with over 100 lbs of luggage) and take stairs 3 levels down to catch a train to the airport. Made it with 5 minutes to spare.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Roberto_MJ
Reviews.Content: Located on the spot at St.Germain, but in a silent spot - good sleep quality. Rooms are not so big, but that's a fact in France. Service is good. Staff was very helpful and corteous. Bar at lobby is very expensive. Braskfast too. But there are plenty of cheap options across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Trendy Holiday INN, who knew!”
Reviews.Author: goinggone
Reviews.Content: This ain't your mother's Holiday Inn. The hotel was great on so many levels. First and foremost- the LOCATION! If you want to stay in the left bank, then the location couldn't be better. No big luxery frills here, just straight up Brand New "Hip" Holiday Inn. The rooms were small, beds comfy, bathroom clean. The hotel even has it's own chic indoor/outdoor lounge area, plus a beautiful rooftop terrace! The price was right! Fabulous. Highly recommend! (One note, although it's labeled Notre Dame Holiday Inn, It's not right next to it. Instead it's down the street. much preferred since who wants to be next to the crowds?)

Reviews.Title: “CHIC HOTEL IN HEART OF PARIS”
Reviews.Author: pascha
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel situated in a quiet street in the heart of Paris. Steps away from Notre Dame Cathedral, St Germain and the left bank of the Seine. The Louvre is a 15 mins stroll away and the Metro just 2 mins. The hotel is eco-contemporary and although the rooms are rather small they are of high quality chic design, air conned and the beds are extremely comfortable. We also had a state of the art bathroom with wonderful power shower. The hotel is one of the few that has a roof terrace with views all over Paris. There is also an quiet courtyard to take breakfast. The reception staff are extremely helpful and if necessary will speak English. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There is no reason to stay anywhere else in France”
Reviews.Author: DallasMom2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and immaculately clean with wonderful, comfy beds and nice bathrooms. Notre Dame is a two minute walk and the Latin Quarter is across the street. Our cab driver did not know the hotel was there because it was so new, and when he saw it, he commented that the location was "se perfect!"...and it was. The breakfast was great as well. The best part was the rooftop patio that overlooks all of Paris and has a beautiful view of the Eiffel Tower. You can take wine and sit and drink at the little tables as the lights of the Eiffel Tower illuminate at night. It was wonderful. For the price, there is absolutely no reason to stay anywhere else in Paris.
